com.esri.mo2.file.shp
Class ShpGeometry

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.file.shp.ShpGeometry
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
MultiPatchShp, MultiPointShp, PointShp, PolygonShp, PolylineShp
public abstract class ShpGeometry
extends Object
implements Cloneable

This is the superclass for all shapefile geometry. It contains the members and methods that are common to all shapes. One important concept to understand is that of a NULL SHAPE. By definition, a NULL SHAPE is a shape that contains no geometry. It can be present in ANY shapefile. Further, it may exist in ANY record. As a result, the isNull() method has been provided to indicate this the presence of this shape type. When you create a new ShpGeometry instance, it is considered to be a null shape until geometry is added to it.

Determines if the shape contains any geometry.

getRangeZ

public abstract double[] getRangeZ()
returns the min and max values of the Z ordinates of the shape

Returns:
array containing the min and max values respectively if the shape supports Z ordinates. Otherwise, null is returned.
